paragraphs.body: Quest Creator is a free game hosted on Nick.com.
paragraphs.text: Quest Creator is a free game hosted on Nick.com.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} must complete four unique quests in order to advance in his mission of defeating the ${link_1}. These quests are:
paragraphs.text: Aang must complete four unique quests in order to advance in his mission of defeating the Fire Nation. These quests are:

paragraphs.body: Rescue ${link_0}: Aang searches for a key that is capable of unlocking the cage that holds Katara.
paragraphs.text: Rescue Katara: Aang searches for a key that is capable of unlocking the cage that holds Katara.

paragraphs.body: Defeat the Enemies: Aang is tasked with knocking out all of his foes.
paragraphs.text: Defeat the Enemies: Aang is tasked with knocking out all of his foes.

paragraphs.body: Hit the Switch: The player should press the space-bar when he or she has gotten Aang next to the "special switch."
paragraphs.text: Hit the Switch: The player should press the space-bar when he or she has gotten Aang next to the "special switch."

paragraphs.body: Gather All Treasures: Aang looks everywhere he can for treasures — "in barrels, crates, behind locked doors, etc."
paragraphs.text: Gather All Treasures: Aang looks everywhere he can for treasures — "in barrels, crates, behind locked doors, etc."

paragraphs.body: Additionally, the player may choose to "Build a Level", the option for which the game is named. Instead of playing through pre-made quests supplied by the game, the player can create his or her own quest.
paragraphs.text: Additionally, the player may choose to "Build a Level", the option for which the game is named. Instead of playing through pre-made quests supplied by the game, the player can create his or her own quest.

paragraphs.body: Space-bar (additional information about space-bar commands in "Instructions")
paragraphs.text: Space-bar (additional information about space-bar commands in "Instructions")

paragraphs.body: "1" or "2" – Initiate one of Aang's ${link_0} moves
paragraphs.text: "1" or "2" – Initiate one of Aang's bending moves

paragraphs.body: As mentioned in the "Objective" section, Quest Creator has two distinct modes of play: Quest mode and "Build a Level" mode. Because of the significant differences between these choices, completely nonparallel sets of instructions are included here through the following subsections.
paragraphs.text: As mentioned in the "Objective" section, Quest Creator has two distinct modes of play: Quest mode and "Build a Level" mode. Because of the significant differences between these choices, completely nonparallel sets of instructions are included here through the following subsections.

paragraphs.body: When one clicks on the "Play" option of the main menu, a map of the ${link_0} appears, prompting the player to click one "country" in which he or she wants to accomplish quests. Once one country has been chosen, the player may click on one of the quests that have been described in the "Objective" section. These quests each have a time limit that restricts the amount of minutes or second that the player may take to finish the quest. This time limit and the area where the quest takes place are decided by which country the player chose. The multiple possibilities and appearances that the quests can take are highlighted in the following list. This list is ordered by the country the player chooses, followed by the different quests' time limits and locations.
paragraphs.text: When one clicks on the "Play" option of the main menu, a map of the four nations appears, prompting the player to click one "country" in which he or she wants to accomplish quests. Once one country has been chosen, the player may click on one of the quests that have been described in the "Objective" section. These quests each have a time limit that restricts the amount of minutes or second that the player may take to finish the quest. This time limit and the area where the quest takes place are decided by which country the player chose. The multiple possibilities and appearances that the quests can take are highlighted in the following list. This list is ordered by the country the player chooses, followed by the different quests' time limits and locations.

paragraphs.body: Obstacles are placed throughout each quest, and such obstacles are numerous and diverse. Enemies range from Fire Nation ${link_0} in the "Find the Treasures" quest of the Air Nomad country to ${link_1} in the "Rescue Katara" quest of the same nation. Others include green-clad pirates, ${link_2} reminiscent of the one at the ${link_3}, ${link_4}, and likely a few more. Aang must avoid these enemies, lest they hit him and cause his health to deplete. When all health is lost, so is the quest. Aang may use his ${link_5} techniques to fend off such enemies and deplete their health as well, until they are defeated and disappear.
paragraphs.text: Obstacles are placed throughout each quest, and such obstacles are numerous and diverse. Enemies range from Fire Nation soldiers in the "Find the Treasures" quest of the Air Nomad country to dragons in the "Rescue Katara" quest of the same nation. Others include green-clad pirates, serpents reminiscent of the one at the Serpent's Pass, unagi, and likely a few more. Aang must avoid these enemies, lest they hit him and cause his health to deplete. When all health is lost, so is the quest. Aang may use his airbending techniques to fend off such enemies and deplete their health as well, until they are defeated and disappear.

paragraphs.body: Among these obstacles are not only adversaries, but also natural phenomena such as quicksand, bodies of water, and cracked ice. Quicksand and cracked ice respectively pull Aang beneath the earth and below the waters causing him to lose the quest. Aang cannot pass through bodies of water. Afterward, there are also patches of hot lava, which engulf Aang and result in the same outcome as the cracked ice and quicksand. In some cases barrels and boxes can obstruct Aang's path and cause the player to slowly run out of time while trying to traverse them, with the barrels and boxes acting as obstacles. There are likely a few more such obstacles as well.
paragraphs.text: Among these obstacles are not only adversaries, but also natural phenomena such as quicksand, bodies of water, and cracked ice. Quicksand and cracked ice respectively pull Aang beneath the earth and below the waters causing him to lose the quest. Aang cannot pass through bodies of water. Afterward, there are also patches of hot lava, which engulf Aang and result in the same outcome as the cracked ice and quicksand. In some cases barrels and boxes can obstruct Aang's path and cause the player to slowly run out of time while trying to traverse them, with the barrels and boxes acting as obstacles. There are likely a few more such obstacles as well.

paragraphs.body: Water scroll — Gives Aang the power of a ${link_0}
paragraphs.text: Water scroll — Gives Aang the power of a water whip

paragraphs.body: Earth scroll — Gives Aang an ${link_0} move that stuns enemies
paragraphs.text: Earth scroll — Gives Aang an earthbending move that stuns enemies

paragraphs.body: Blue key — Opens a standard locked door
paragraphs.text: Blue key — Opens a standard locked door

paragraphs.body: "Build a Level" employs all of the previously mentioned objects, adversaries, locations, items, and natural phenomena, if the player so chooses to include them in his or her creation. The description of this option of play is practically impossible: the bounds of how it works and its possibilities can only be decided by the player. It requires a Nick.com membership, which is free.
paragraphs.text: "Build a Level" employs all of the previously mentioned objects, adversaries, locations, items, and natural phenomena, if the player so chooses to include them in his or her creation. The description of this option of play is practically impossible: the bounds of how it works and its possibilities can only be decided by the player. It requires a Nick.com membership, which is free.

paragraphs.body: The image of Aang used on this game's title card was recycled onto the title card of ${link_0}.
paragraphs.text: The image of Aang used on this game's title card was recycled onto the title card of Jingle Brawl.

paragraphs.body: Aang and Katara's in-game sprites (likenesses in the midst of a quest) bear resemblance to those in another Nick.com game, ${link_0}.
paragraphs.text: Aang and Katara's in-game sprites (likenesses in the midst of a quest) bear resemblance to those in another Nick.com game, Ashes in the Air.

paragraphs.body: While some of the names used for the locations of quests in Quest Creator, like "Kyoshi Island" and "Omashu", are correct, others are either worded differently from their inspirations' names ("${link_0}" to "Forest of Ashes", "${link_1}" to "Crescent Moon Isle", etc.) or entirely made up ("Little desert", "Snowy cliffs", and so on).
paragraphs.text: While some of the names used for the locations of quests in Quest Creator, like "Kyoshi Island" and "Omashu", are correct, others are either worded differently from their inspirations' names ("Scorched forest" to "Forest of Ashes", "Crescent Island" to "Crescent Moon Isle", etc.) or entirely made up ("Little desert", "Snowy cliffs", and so on).
